alert.note: Alert for Greene; Hale; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 22 at 5:40PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Greene, northwestern Hale and central Sumter Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 540 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bluffport, or near Livingston, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Livingston, Eutaw, Moundville, Forkland, Akron, Boligee, Epes, Walden Quarters, The University Of West Alabama, Thornhill, Wedgeworth, Tishabee, Allison, Bluffport, Knoxville, Coatopa, Evansville, Moundville Airport, Eutaw Municipal Airport and Mound State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for west central Alabama.
